quoteText: Indeed, with hardship [comes] ease.
And whoever fears Allah â€“ He will make for him a way out.
And We have certainly made the Quran easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?
Do not lose hope, nor be sad.
And your Lord is the Forgiving, Full of Mercy.
And He found you lost and guided [you].
And We will surely give you a reward.
Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
He who has Allah has everything.
Indeed, Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves.
Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam.
And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
O you who believe, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, 'O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice.'

And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], 'Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah.' Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yes, we have testified.' [This] - lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, 'Indeed, we were of this unaware.'

And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them [by performing them]. [Allah] said, 'Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people.' [Abraham] said, 'And of my descendants?' [Allah] said, 'My covenant does not include the wrongdoers.'

And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], 'Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.'
Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a giver of good tidings and a warner to all mankind, but most of the people do not know.

And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I am going to place upon the earth a successive authority.' They said, 'Will You place upon it one who causes corruption in it and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?' [Allah] said, 'Indeed, I know that which you do not know.'
Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I am going to place upon the earth a successive authority.'
